name: shim
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a small object or piece of material used between two parts of something to make them fit together, or to prevent them rubbing against each other: A small metal shim will be used to keep the pedals from sticking. Shims under the shoe cleats correct variances to foot tilt.
More examplesFewer examplesBefore a race, he uses razor-thin shims to align the runners to .005 of an inch accuracy.The repair involves installing a steel shim a couple of millimetres thick in the pedal assembly.I was bolting them up using a bag full of shims.

to put a shim (= a small object or piece of material) between two parts of something to make them fit together, or to prevent them rubbing against each other: The baseboards have been cut, shimmed, sealed, and nailed. Be sure to shim the frames so they remain level and plumb after they're fastened in place.
